subject: Re: [junit] Something wrong doing JUnit Plug-in Test in Eclipse

messageBody:
On 13/07/05, Ferad Zyulkyarov <feradz@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I am trying to write a JUnit Test Plug-in for another Eclipse plugin
> that is a view part. What the test plug-in has to do is to open a new
> wrokbench, show the view, do some comparisons regarding the contents
> of the view and hide the view. The problem that I experience is that
> the JUnit TestCase does not lunch because the JUnit plugin can not be
> located (loaded). I want to note that I did included the JUnit plugin
> as a dependency plugin for the JUnit Test plugin.
>
> The error that is printed on the console is given below. I think this
> is not a big issue. Hope that your help will help me overcome it.
> Thanks a lot for your help.
>
> Exception in thread "Thread-1" org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to
> execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/framework/TestCase)

Hi,

I haven't seen that specific problem before. But it might help to post to an
eclipse list, where the members would be better placed to help you with
classpath issues when writing / testing plugins, along with providing your
plugin.xml.

Off the top of my head I think you might want to check that you have an
import for org.junit in your requires element. I personally found Kent Beck
and Erich Gamma's book 'Contributing to Eclipse' very easy to follow in
getting going with TDD of Eclipse plugins, so you could do worse than get
your hands on a copy of that as well.

HTH,

James
